title: Isolate the Quadratic Term
text: We add $$2$$ on both sides to get $$r^2$$ by itself which gives $$5r^2=36$$.

title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"
text: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives $$r^2=\frac{36}{5}$$.

title: Use Square root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $$r^2=\frac{36}{5}$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$r=\sqrt{\frac{36}{5}}$$ or $$r=-\sqrt{\frac{36}{5}}$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$5r^2-2$$ $$=$$ $$34$$ has two solutions which are $$r=-6\sqrt{\frac{1}{5}}$$, and $$r=6\sqrt{\frac{1}{5}}$$.
